attributes.action: abolish tax on milage we pay to visit clients in the community.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: we as community mental health staff visit many clients in the community on a daily basis. we are paid milage of course  (not in line with inflation) however we have just received a tax letter to tell us that again we will be taxed on the milage we drive over the year.we are taxed at the pump,again in our monthly wage and again annually.we cannot do this job without cars and therefore fuel and i find it disgraceful we are taxed three times for this. can anyone out there explain why this happens. i believe this is shameful and just another tax on the lowest paid, hard working people in the NHS.
